query: Contracts with revenue sharing AND non-compete

result.cypher: MATCH (c:Contract)-[:CONTAINS]->(cl1:Clause)-[:OF_TYPE]->(ct1:ClauseType), (c)-[:CONTAINS]->(cl2:Clause)-[:OF_TYPE]->(ct2:ClauseType) WHERE ct1.name = 'Revenue/Profit Sharing' AND ct2.name = 'Non-Compete' RETURN c.id as c_id, c.title as c_title, c.num_clauses as c_num_clauses, c.context as c_context, cl1.text as cl1_text, cl1.id as cl1_id, ct1.name as ct1_name, cl2.text as cl2_text, cl2.id as cl2_id, ct2.name as ct2_name LIMIT 50

analysis.summary: The query identified contracts that contain both revenue sharing and non-compete clauses. These 'locked-in' partnerships represent high-value relationships with both financial incentives and contractual restrictions.
insights: Contracts with both revenue sharing and non-compete clauses create mutually beneficial partnerships with strong retention mechanisms.
These dual-clause contracts represent strategic business relationships where both parties have aligned financial and competitive interests.
The combination of revenue sharing and non-compete provisions indicates mature, well-structured partnership agreements.
riskFlags: High-value relationships: These contracts represent significant business partnerships
Retention mechanisms: Non-compete clauses may limit future business flexibility
Financial dependencies: Revenue sharing creates ongoing financial relationships
recommendations: Review these contracts during M&A due diligence to understand partnership lock-in value.
Assess the impact of non-compete clauses on future business strategy and expansion opportunities.
Evaluate revenue sharing terms to ensure they remain competitive and aligned with business objectives.
